command.name: _complete
command.help:
Internal command to provide shell completion suggestions

Options:
--shell(-s)The shell type ("bash")
--input(-i)An array of input tokens (e.g. COMP_WORDS or argv)
--current(-c)The index of the "input" array that the cursor is in (e.g. COMP_CWORD)
--symfony(-S)The version of the completion script
--help(-h)Display help for the given command. When no command is given display help for the list command
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce (or disable --no-ansi) ANSI output
--no-ansiNegate the "--ansi" option
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitch off debug mode.

option.name: --input
option.help: An array of input tokens (e.g. COMP_WORDS or argv)

option.name: --current
option.help: The index of the "input" array that the cursor is in (e.g. COMP_CWORD)

option.name: --symfony
option.help: The version of the completion script

option.name: --help
option.help: Display help for the given command. When no command is given display help for the list command

option.name: --verbose
option.help: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --no-interaction
option.help: Do not ask any interactive question

command.name: about
command.help:
The about command displays information about the current Symfony project.

The PHP section displays important configuration that could affect your application. The values might
be different between web and CLI.

Options:
--help(-h)Display help for the given command. When no command is given display help for the list command
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce (or disable --no-ansi) ANSI output
--no-ansiNegate the "--ansi" option
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitch off debug mode.

command.name: completion
command.help:
The completion command dumps the shell completion script required
to use shell autocompletion (currently only bash completion is supported).

Static installation
-------------------

Dump the script to a global completion file and restart your shell:

C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console completion bash | sudo tee /etc/bash_completion.d/console

Or dump the script to a local file and source it:

C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console completion bash > completion.sh

# source the file whenever you use the project
source completion.sh

# or add this line at the end of your "~/.bashrc" file:
source /path/to/completion.sh

Dynamic installation
--------------------

Add this to the end of your shell configuration file (e.g. "~/.bashrc"):

eval "$(C:\xampp\htdocs\symf\syfApp\bin\console completion bash)"

Options:
--debugTail the completion debug log
--help(-h)Display help for the given command. When no command is given display help for the list command
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce (or disable --no-ansi) ANSI output
--no-ansiNegate the "--ansi" option
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitch off debug mode.

option.name: --help
option.help: Display help for the given command. When no command is given display help for the list command

option.name: --verbose
option.help: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --no-interaction
option.help: Do not ask any interactive question

command.name: help
command.help:
The help command displays help for a given command:

C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console help list

You can also output the help in other formats by using the --format option:

C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console help --format=xml list

To display the list of available commands, please use the list command.

Options:
--formatThe output format (txt, xml, json, or md)
--rawTo output raw command help
--help(-h)Display help for the given command. When no command is given display help for the list command
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce (or disable --no-ansi) ANSI output
--no-ansiNegate the "--ansi" option
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitch off debug mode.

option.help: The output format (txt, xml, json, or md)

command.name: list
command.help:
The list command lists all commands:

C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console list

You can also display the commands for a specific namespace:

C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console list test

You can also output the information in other formats by using the --format option:

C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console list --format=xml

It's also possible to get raw list of commands (useful for embedding command runner):

C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console list --raw

Options:
--rawTo output raw command list
--formatThe output format (txt, xml, json, or md)
--shortTo skip describing commands' arguments
--help(-h)Display help for the given command. When no command is given display help for the list command
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce (or disable --no-ansi) ANSI output
--no-ansiNegate the "--ansi" option
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitch off debug mode.

command.name: assets:install
command.help:
The assets:install command installs bundle assets into a given
directory (e.g. the public directory).

php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console assets:install public

A "bundles" directory will be created inside the target directory and the
"Resources/public" directory of each bundle will be copied into it.

To create a symlink to each bundle instead of copying its assets, use the
--symlink option (will fall back to hard copies when symbolic links aren't possible:

php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console assets:install public --symlink

To make symlink relative, add the --relative option:

php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console assets:install public --symlink --relative


Options:
--symlinkSymlink the assets instead of copying them
--relativeMake relative symlinks
--no-cleanupDo not remove the assets of the bundles that no longer exist
--help(-h)Display help for the given command. When no command is given display help for the list command
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce (or disable --no-ansi) ANSI output
--no-ansiNegate the "--ansi" option
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitch off debug mode.

option.help: Symlink the assets instead of copying them

option.name: --no-cleanup
option.help: Do not remove the assets of the bundles that no longer exist

command.name: cache:clear
command.help:
The cache:clear command clears and warms up the application cache for a given environment
and debug mode:

php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console cache:clear --env=dev
php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console cache:clear --env=prod --no-debug

Options:
--no-warmupDo not warm up the cache
--no-optional-warmersSkip optional cache warmers (faster)
--help(-h)Display help for the given command. When no command is given display help for the list command
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce (or disable --no-ansi) ANSI output
--no-ansiNegate the "--ansi" option
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitch off debug mode.

command.name: config:dump-reference
command.help:
The config:dump-reference command dumps the default configuration for an
extension/bundle.

Either the extension alias or bundle name can be used:

php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console config:dump-reference framework
php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console config:dump-reference FrameworkBundle

With the --format option specifies the format of the configuration,
this is either yaml or xml.
When the option is not provided, yaml is used.

php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console config:dump-reference FrameworkBundle --format=xml

For dumping a specific option, add its path as second argument (only available for the yaml format):

php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console config:dump-reference framework profiler.matcher


Options:
--formatThe output format (yaml or xml)
--help(-h)Display help for the given command. When no command is given display help for the list command
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce (or disable --no-ansi) ANSI output
--no-ansiNegate the "--ansi" option
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitch off debug mode.

command.name: debug:autowiring
command.help:
The debug:autowiring command displays the classes and interfaces that
you can use as type-hints for autowiring:

php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console debug:autowiring

You can also pass a search term to filter the list:

php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console debug:autowiring log


Options:

--no-ansiNegate the "--ansi" option
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitch off debug mode.

command.name: debug:config
command.help:
The debug:config command dumps the current configuration for an
extension/bundle.

Either the extension alias or bundle name can be used:

php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console debug:config framework
php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console debug:config FrameworkBundle

For dumping a specific option, add its path as second argument:

php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console debug:config framework serializer.enabled

command.name: debug:container
command.help:
The debug:container command displays all configured public services:

php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console debug:container

To see deprecations generated during container compilation and cache warmup, use the --deprecations option:

php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console debug:container --deprecations

To get specific information about a service, specify its name:

php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console debug:container validator

To get specific information about a service including all its arguments, use the --show-arguments flag:

php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console debug:container validator --show-arguments

To see available types that can be used for autowiring, use the --types flag:

php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console debug:container --types

To see environment variables used by the container, use the --env-vars flag:

php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console debug:container --env-vars

Display a specific environment variable by specifying its name with the --env-var option:

php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console debug:container --env-var=APP_ENV

Use the --tags option to display tagged public services grouped by tag:

php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console debug:container --tags

Find all services with a specific tag by specifying the tag name with the --tag option:

php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console debug:container --tag=form.type

Use the --parameters option to display all parameters:

php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console debug:container --parameters

Display a specific parameter by specifying its name with the --parameter option:

php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console debug:container --parameter=kernel.debug

By default, internal services are hidden. You can display them
using the --show-hidden flag:

php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console debug:container --show-hidden


Options:
--show-argumentsShow arguments in services
--show-hiddenShow hidden (internal) services
--tagShow all services with a specific tag
--tagsDisplay tagged services for an application
--parameterDisplay a specific parameter for an application
--parametersDisplay parameters for an application
--typesDisplay types (classes/interfaces) available in the container
--env-varDisplay a specific environment variable used in the container
--env-varsDisplay environment variables used in the container
--formatThe output format (txt, xml, json, or md)
--rawTo output raw description
--deprecationsDisplay deprecations generated when compiling and warming up the container
--help(-h)Display help for the given command. When no command is given display help for the list command
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce (or disable --no-ansi) ANSI output
--no-ansiNegate the "--ansi" option
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitch off debug mode.

command.name: lint:container
command.help:
This command parses service definitions and ensures that injected values match the type declarations of each services' class.

Options:
--help(-h)Display help for the given command. When no command is given display help for the list command
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce (or disable --no-ansi) ANSI output

option.name: --no-interaction

command.name: lint:yaml
command.help:
The lint:yaml command lints a YAML file and outputs to STDOUT
the first encountered syntax error.

You can validates YAML contents passed from STDIN:

cat filename | php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console lint:yaml -

You can also validate the syntax of a file:

php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console lint:yaml filename

Or of a whole directory:

php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console lint:yaml dirname
php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console lint:yaml dirname --format=json

You can also exclude one or more specific files:

php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console lint:yaml dirname --exclude="dirname/foo.yaml" --exclude="dirname/bar.yaml"

Or find all files in a bundle:

php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console lint:yaml @AcmeDemoBundle


Options:
--formatThe output format
--excludePath(s) to exclude
--parse-tagsParse custom tags
--no-parse-tagsNegate the "--parse-tags" option
--help(-h)Display help for the given command. When no command is given display help for the list command

command.name: make:auth
command.help:
The make:auth command generates various authentication systems,
by asking questions.

It can provide an empty authenticator, or a full login form authentication process.
In both cases it also updates your security.yaml.
For the login form, it also generates a controller and the twig template.

php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console make:auth

You can also generate the controller alone, without template with this option:

command.name: make:entity
command.help:
The make:entity command creates or updates an entity and repository class.

php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console make:entity BlogPost

If the argument is missing, the command will ask for the entity class name interactively.

You can also mark this class as an API Platform resource. A hypermedia CRUD API will
automatically be available for this entity class:

php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console make:entity --api-resource

Symfony can also broadcast all changes made to the entity to the client using Symfony
UX Turbo.

php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console make:entity --broadcast

You can also generate all the getter/setter/adder/remover methods
for the properties of existing entities:

php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console make:entity --regenerate

You can also *overwrite* any existing methods:

php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console make:entity --regenerate --overwrite


Options:
--api-resource(-a)Mark this class as an API Platform resource (expose a CRUD API for it)
--broadcast(-b)Add the ability to broadcast entity updates using Symfony UX Turbo?
--regenerateInstead of adding new fields, simply generate the methods (e.g. getter/setter) for existing fields
--overwriteOverwrite any existing getter/setter methods
--help(-h)Display help for the given command. When no command is given display help for the list command
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce (or disable --no-ansi) ANSI output
--no-ansiNegate the "--ansi" option
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitch off debug mode.

option.name: --api-resource
option.help: Mark this class as an API Platform resource (expose a CRUD API for it)

option.name: --broadcast
option.help: Add the ability to broadcast entity updates using Symfony UX Turbo?

option.name: --regenerate
option.help: Instead of adding new fields, simply generate the methods (e.g. getter/setter) for existing fields

command.name: make:form
command.help:
The make:form command generates a new form class.

php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console make:form UserType

If the argument is missing, the command will ask for the form class interactively.

You can optionally specify the bound class in a second argument.
This can be the name of an entity like User

php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console make:form UserType User

You can also specify a fully qualified name to another class like \App\Dto\UserData.
Slashes must be escaped in the argument.

php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console make:form UserType \\App\\Dto\\UserData

command.name: make:reset-password
command.help:
The make:reset-password command generates all the files needed to implement
a fully-functional & secure password reset system.

The SymfonycastsResetPasswordBundle is required and can be added using composer:
composer require symfonycasts/reset-password-bundle

For more information on the reset-password-bundle check out:
https://github.com/symfonycasts/reset-password-bundle

make:reset-password requires a user entity with an email property,
email getter method, and a password setter method. Maker will ask for these
interactively if they cannot be guessed.

Maker will also update your reset-password.yaml configuration file
if one exists. If you have customized the configuration file, maker will attempt
to modify it accordingly but preserve your customizations.

php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console make:reset-password

command.name: make:test
command.help:
The make:test command generates a new test class.

php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console make:test TestCase BlogPostTest

If the first argument is missing, the command will ask for the test type interactively.

If the second argument is missing, the command will ask for the class name interactively.
* TestCase: basic PHPUnit tests
* KernelTestCase: basic tests that have access to Symfony services
* WebTestCase: to run browser-like scenarios, but that don't execute JavaScript code
* ApiTestCase: to run API-oriented scenarios
* PantherTestCase: to run e2e scenarios, using a real-browser or HTTP client and a real web server

command.name: make:user
command.help:
The make:user command generates a new user class for security
and updates your security.yaml file for it. It will also generate a user provider
class if your situation needs a custom class.

php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console make:user User

If the argument is missing, the command will ask for the class name interactively.


Options:
--is-entityDo you want to store user data in the database (via Doctrine)?
--identity-property-nameEnter a property name that will be the unique "display" name for the user (e.g. email, username, uuid)
--with-passwordWill this app be responsible for checking the password? Choose No if the password is actually checked by some other system (e.g. a single sign-on server)
--use-argon2Use the Argon2i password encoder? (deprecated)
--help(-h)Display help for the given command. When no command is given display help for the list command
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

--no-ansiNegate the "--ansi" option
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitch off debug mode.

option.name: --is-entity
option.help: Do you want to store user data in the database (via Doctrine)?

option.name: --identity-property-name
option.help: Enter a property name that will be the unique "display" name for the user (e.g. <comment>email, username, uuid</comment>)

option.name: --with-password
option.help: Will this app be responsible for checking the password? Choose <comment>No</comment> if the password is actually checked by some other system (e.g. a single sign-on server)

option.name: --help
option.help: Display help for the given command. When no command is given display help for the list command

option.name: --verbose
option.help: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --no-interaction
option.help: Do not ask any interactive question

command.name: make:validator
command.help:
The make:validator command generates a new validation constraint.

php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console make:validator EnabledValidator

If the argument is missing, the command will ask for the constraint class name interactively.


Options:
--help(-h)Display help for the given command. When no command is given display help for the list command
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce (or disable --no-ansi) ANSI output
--no-ansiNegate the "--ansi" option
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitch off debug mode.

command.name: router:match
command.help:
The router:match shows which routes match a given request and which don't and for what reason:

php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console router:match /foo

or

php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console router:match /foo --method POST --scheme https --host symfony.com --verbose


Options:
--methodSet the HTTP method
--schemeSet the URI scheme (usually http or https)
--hostSet the URI host

--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--env(-e)The Environment name.

command.name: secrets:decrypt-to-local
command.help:
The secrets:decrypt-to-local command decrypts all secrets and copies them in the local vault.

C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console secrets:decrypt-to-local

When the option --force is provided, secrets that already exist in the local vault are overriden.

C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console secrets:decrypt-to-local --force

Options:
--force(-f)Force overriding of secrets that already exist in the local vault
--help(-h)Display help for the given command. When no command is given display help for the list command
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce (or disable --no-ansi) ANSI output
--no-ansiNegate the "--ansi" option
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitch off debug mode.

command.name: secrets:generate-keys
command.help:
The secrets:generate-keys command generates a new encryption key.

C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console secrets:generate-keys

If encryption keys already exist, the command must be called with
the --rotate option in order to override those keys and re-encrypt
existing secrets.

C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console secrets:generate-keys --rotate

Options:
--local(-l)Update the local vault.
--rotate(-r)Re-encrypt existing secrets with the newly generated keys.

--quiet(-q)Do not output any message

--no-ansiNegate the "--ansi" option
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitch off debug mode.

option.help: Re-encrypt existing secrets with the newly generated keys.

command.name: secrets:set
command.help:
The secrets:set command stores a secret in the vault.

C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console secrets:set

To reference secrets in services.yaml or any other config
files, use "%env()%".

By default, the secret value should be entered interactively.
Alternatively, provide a file where to read the secret from:

php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console secrets:set filename

Use "-" as a file name to read from STDIN:

cat filename | php C:/xampp/htdocs/symf/syfApp/bin/console secrets:set -

Use --local to override secrets for local needs.

Options:
--local(-l)Update the local vault.
--random(-r)Generate a random value.
--help(-h)Display help for the given command. When no command is given display help for the list command
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce (or disable --no-ansi) ANSI output
--no-ansiNegate the "--ansi" option
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitch off debug mode.
